authdriver.name: remote
authdriver.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Remote authentication]
authdriver.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Authentication is done remotely (useful in CMS system).]

param.name: CMS_TYPE
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[CMS Type]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Choose a predefined CMS or define your custom values]

param.name: SECRET
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Secret key]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[This key must only be known by remote end]

param.name: MASTER_URL
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Wordpress URL]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[URL of your WP installation, either http://host/path or simply /path if it's on the same host]

param.name: LOGIN_URI
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Login URI]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[When not in slave mode, AJXP calls the given URL as URL?name=XXX&pass=XXX&key=XXX. Else it redirect to the given URL]

param.name: MASTER_AUTH_FUNCTION
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Master Auth Function]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[User-defined function for performing real password check, necessary for REST API (including iOS client)]

param.name: LOGOUT_ACTION
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Exit Action]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Choose the action performed when the user wants to quit AjaXplorer : either trigger a Joomla! logout, or simply go back to the main page.]

param.name: MASTER_URL
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Joomla! URL]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Full path to Joomla! installation, either in the form of http://localhost/joomla/ or simply /joomla/]

param.name: LOGIN_URI
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Home node]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Main page of your Joomla! installation that contains a login form. When not logged, accessing AjaXplorer will redirect to this page. It's also used for the API calls for logging in a user from within AjaXplorer. Make sure it does contain a login form!]

param.name: MASTER_AUTH_FUNCTION
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Master Auth Function]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[User-defined function for performing real password check, necessary for REST API (including iOS client)]

param.name: MASTER_AUTH_FORM_ID
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Auth Form ID]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[The HTML ID of the form tag displayed for login on the page defined previously. Not necessary for WP, login-form by default for Joomla, and user-login-form for Drupal]

param.name: LOGOUT_ACTION
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Exit Action]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Choose the action performed when the user wants to quit AjaXplorer : either trigger a Joomla! logout, or simply go back to the main page.]

param.name: MASTER_URL
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Drupal URL]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Full path to Drupal installation, either in the form of http://localhost/drupal/ or simply /drupal/]

param.name: LOGIN_URI
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Login URL]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Main page of your Drupal installation that contains a login form. When not logged, accessing AjaXplorer will redirect to this page. It's also used for the API calls for logging in a user from within AjaXplorer. Make sure it does contain a login form.]

param.name: MASTER_AUTH_FORM_ID
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Auth Form ID]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[The HTML ID of the form tag displayed for login on the page defined previously. Not necessary for WP, login-form by default for Joomla, and user-login-form for Drupal]

param.name: LOGOUT_ACTION
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Exit Action]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Choose the action performed when the user wants to quit AjaXplorer : either trigger a Joomla! logout, or simply go back to the main page.]

param.name: LOGIN_URL
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Login URL]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[When not in slave mode, AJXP calls the given URL as URL?name=XXX&pass=XXX&key=XXX. Else it redirect to the given URL]

param.name: LOGOUT_URL
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Logout URL]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Redirect to the given URL on loggin out]

param.name: MASTER_AUTH_FUNCTION
param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Custom Auth Function]
param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[User-defined function for performing real password check, necessary for REST API (including iOS client). Add this function inside the plugin cms_auth_functions.php file]
